required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Electromyographic Assessment of the Shoulder Stabilizing Musculature in CrossFit® Athletes
clinical_study.official_title: Electromyographic Assessment of the Shoulder Stabilizing Musculature in CrossFit® Athletes. An Observational Analytical Study of Case-controls Prevalence

lead_sponsor.agency: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

clinical_study.source: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational analytical study of prevalent cases and controls.

detailed_description.textblock: Approximately 39 subjects who practice CrossFit at least 6 hours a week are invitated to participate in this observational study. It will measure the activation of trapezius and Serratus muscles by Electromyography experiencing a feeling of fatigue 7-8 in PushPress and PullUps.

primary_outcome.measure: Observation of Basal Activation in Trapezius and Serratus muscles and after Push-Press and Pull-Up exercises assessed by Electromyographic mDurance®
primary_outcome.description: Trapezius and Serratus muscle activation analysis in CrossFit athletes with Electromyography system for the muscle activity assessment with the electrode tools

study_pop.textblock: Athletes and amateurs who practice CrossFit® discipline, who have mastered the basic exercises of Pull-up and Push-Press.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Practicing CrossFit® for at least 1 year
- A minimum of 6 hours per week CrossFit® training
- No shoulder pain at the time of measurement
Exclusion Criteria:
- Tendinitis
- Bursitis
- Sistematic disease
- Nurological disease
- Central or periferic disease

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia
